title: Mission Description
content: Through a sneaky magic trick, you get your hands on the gift money and your cornerstone, the Aventurine. Things get ugly, but your plan is still being executed at a timely pace. Not even the impending death can stop you.Distribute the gift money to the pedestrians to exchange for the intel you need.

speaker: Dr. Ratio
line: You look pale. Or, is that also part of your act?

speaker: Aventurine
line: Didn't think you'd have the nerve to show yourself.

speaker: Dr. Ratio
line: I thought this was exactly what you wanted. After all, I faithfully fulfilled my duties as you instructed.

speaker: Dr. Ratio
line: Just tell me if you can't hold on any longer.

speaker: Aventurine
line: So, the "genius" of the Council of Mundanites wants to be my undertaker now? My... what an honor.

speaker: Dr. Ratio
line: Yeah, and I'm pretty sure the people at the Strategic Investment Department would love to be notified of your death in due time, but let's not forget you won't be seeing them, because I'm the manager of this task.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Great, then tell your people that Aventurine is ready to go in seventeen system hours.

speaker: Dr. Ratio
line: You've got a lot of nerve — how exactly do you plan on completing your task while your hands are tied by the Harmony ?

speaker: Aventurine
line: My conversation with Sunday convinced me that there's a traitor in The Family , and that they hold the secrets of Penacony... So, I took the opportunity to set everything in motion.

speaker: Aventurine
line: I even managed to recover the gift money. Things haven't gone this smoothly since I walked through the doors of The Reverie... Now, I'm only one step away from victory. Let's just wait and see.

speaker: Dr. Ratio
line: Sounds like a very elaborate way of saying that you failed.

speaker: Aventurine
line: That's all I can say. Have you forgotten, Doctor? You betrayed me.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Go, do what you must. I look forward to the sight of the IPC fleet surrounding Penacony . You've achieved what you desired, haven't you?

speaker: Dr. Ratio
line: That's true, but what's your plan? Did you conceal an Orbital Support beacon in that gift money bag?

speaker: Aventurine
line: Well, who knows? Maybe that's why I'm handing out cash even when I'm about to bite the dust.

speaker: Dr. Ratio
line: ...You are indeed a gambler — an insane one at that.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Well, maybe I am. Who knows?

speaker: Dr. Ratio
line: Fine. Here, take this. Open it when you're on your last legs. You'll thank me.

speaker: Aventurine
line: What's this...? Medical advice?

speaker: Aventurine
line: You catch on pretty fast, Doctor.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Asking me to solve a case without giving a single clue... How typical of you, you wing-headed scoundrel.

speaker: Aventurine
line: But the way you're all on edge about that stowaway, it's just as I guessed it would be. As for now... let the rain of wealth from the IPC fall evenly on everyone.

text: Distribute gems and ask around for clues regarding the stowaways

speaker: Chabro
line: The world has truly lost its way...

text: Here, I got these gems for you.

speaker: Chabro
line: You... Wait, I get it now! This is some sort of prank show, right? You must have some cameras set up around here to film yourself doing good deeds, right?

speaker: Chabro
line: You youngsters are always looking for a quick way to get an audience, but you know what? A truly great show never comes easy.

speaker: Aventurine
line: A great show will start soon, old man. But before that, I need to ask you something. Do you know where I can find "Death" in this dream?

speaker: Chabro
line: Ah, I see! Another fearless youngster looking for death, huh? Well, let me give you a piece of advice. Don't think you're the first one who's ever thought of that idea.

speaker: Chabro
line: Death? Not even remotely innovative. I bought it from Dr. Edward . He claimed it was some exclusive fancy-schmancy stuff... But what a disappointment.

speaker: Chabro
line: The effects were awful. First, some monster covered in eyes stabs you in the gut, and then all you see are blurry glimpses of buildings and lights. The sky was spinning so fast it almost made me puke...

speaker: Aventurine
line: Is that all?

speaker: Chabro
line: Yeah, what else can you expect? Don't put too much stock in the Penacony movie industry... They even call this junk "groundbreaking art," can you believe it?

speaker: Aventurine
line: ...What a joke. Well, I'll leave you be, then. I hope you have a wonderful day!

speaker: Aventurine
line: (A monster covered in eyes... that sounds like the Memory Zone Meme, but buildings and lights... I don't think those have anything to do with "Death." That whole dream bubble was probably created using rumors and gossip.)

speaker: Chabro
line: The world has truly lost its way...

text: It's not yet time to do this now — give out the gems and get some clues on the stowaway, then see if *that girl* will take the bait.

speaker: Aventurine
line: (Ehhh... I can feel something inside my head... Is the "Harmony" starting to kick in?)

speaker: Larose
line: Would you be willing to support my performance, and keep the Song of Beauty alive in the cosmos?

text: Here, I got these gems for you.

speaker: Larose
line: Wow, how fabulous! But why would you give such a wonderful gift to a random stranger like me?

speaker: Aventurine
line: Well, you see... I can't bear to see anyone in this sweet dream suffering from poverty.

speaker: Larose
line: That's... incredibly kind of you. Thank you so much, sir. If you ever get the chance, please feel free to come by and indulge in my singing.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Sure thing. By the way, do you happen to know anything interesting about "Death"?

speaker: Larose
line: "Death"? That's... a pretty scary topic, and it doesn't really match the mood of this sweet dream.

speaker: Aventurine
line: You see, I'm a tabloid reporter collecting ghost stories in Penacony. As you know, the more chilling the stories... the more attention they get. Maybe you could help me out?

speaker: Larose
line: Well, if you're up for some gossip... It's not about death, but there have been some rumors about a guest at the reality Hotel who fell into a deep sleep and didn't wake up.

speaker: Larose
line: It was like they were in some sort of coma. Nobody knows what caused it, but luckily, the customer eventually regained consciousness... Well, all customers are under the protection of The Family, after all.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Thank you. This will make for a very juicy headline. May Xipe protect us.

speaker: Aventurine
line: (Unexplained coma? That's actually what happens to your body if your brain dies in a dream, but unfortunately, the customer ended up waking up in the end.)

speaker: Larose
line: Would you be willing to support my performance, and keep the Song of Beauty alive in the cosmos?

speaker: Aventurine
line: (The disturbing voice in my head... it's getting closer.)

speaker: Bocchi
line: A sip of liquor, a blissful reprieve... To drown a thousand sorrows, let worries leave... Hah, I know I have what it takes to become a poet...

text: Here, I got these gems for you.

speaker: Bocchi
line: Oh? You... you are giving... these gems to me? Didn't expect to meet such a generous soul in this place...

speaker: Bocchi
line: Or are you just pitying me? Well, it doesn't really matter... As long as I have... SoulGlad ... that's enough. This is just a dream after all... Haha...

speaker: Aventurine
line: You really shouldn't drink so much SoulGlad, my friend. It's not good for your health.

speaker: Bocchi
line: Oh! Hah, maybe I really should quit... but not before meeting... the Devil of SoulGlad...

speaker: Aventurine
line: The Devil of SoulGlad... Care to elaborate?

speaker: Bocchi
line: Haha... yeah... It's a... seahorse... with a long neck!

speaker: Bocchi
line: They say... it loves to appear to drunk people... especially the ones... who are passed out on the side of the road! Hah! How funny...

speaker: Aventurine
line: ...Yeah, very funny indeed. Thank you.

speaker: Bocchi
line: A sip of liquor, a blissful reprieve... To drown a thousand sorrows, let worries leave... Hah, I know I have what it takes to become a poet...

speaker: Aventurine
line: (Does everyone have to go through so much torment before joining The Family?... Darn it, now I just want to dig out my brain and use it as evidence...)

speaker: Woolsey
line: Take care, my friend. If you ever find yourself in danger, remember that the Hounds are always ready to help.

text: Here, I got these gems for you.
The expression on this hunk of a man was complex, as if he were looking at a mud-soaked sparrow, unable to fly and nearing its end.

speaker: Woolsey
line: You don't look good, my friend... If you need assistance, I can contact the hotel and have them wake you up forcefully.

speaker: Aventurine
line: That won't be necessary. I have some business to attend to... but thank you all the same.

speaker: Woolsey
line: Alright then. If you ever need help, don't hesitate to reach out to us Hounds .

speaker: Aventurine
line: Well, actually, I do need a favor... As the most outstanding Hound in Penacony, have you come across any stowaways recently?

speaker: Woolsey
line: Stowaways? How could there be stowaways in Penacony? We've never had anything like that before.

speaker: Aventurine
line: All right... Good luck with your work, then.

speaker: Aventurine
line: (What was I even thinking...? The Family would never share intel with the IPC...)

speaker: Woolsey
line: Take care, my friend. If you ever find yourself in danger, remember that the Hounds are always ready to help.

speaker: Uma
line: You want to talk to me? Sure, but nothing too sensitive, okay?

text: Here, I got these gems for you.

speaker: Uma
line: Wealthy people have fancy ways to enjoy this dream, but to be honest, I've never seen anyone who gives out money to others like you.

speaker: Uma
line: So, are you trying to be the prince from the tale, handing out his gold-leaf garment and melting his lead heart in the fire?

speaker: Aventurine
line: Haha, I'm flattered. I'm no prince, and I just thought these gems would help you speak. So, as an investigative reporter, maybe you have heard of something about "Death"?

speaker: Uma
line: Another curious soul, I see. Well, that was actually the topic I was most into when I entered the industry, but my boss shut it down.

speaker: Aventurine
line: How did your boss talk you out of it?

speaker: Uma
line: Well... She simply said, "Covering baseless urban legends like that would make us look like some third-rate tabloid."

speaker: Uma
line: I thought about it, and she had a point... Reporting on stuff like blowing out birthday candles and getting spooked by nightmare ghosts... isn't exactly professional material.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Heh, I guess she's got a point... Thank you for sharing.

speaker: Uma
line: You want to talk to me? Sure, but nothing too sensitive, okay?

speaker: Barrle
line: Hmm... Were you wanting to talk to me? Sorry, I thought you were checking out something behind me.

text: Here, I got these gems for you.

speaker: Barrle
line: Is this... a gift for me? Are you sure this isn't some kind of mistake?

speaker: Aventurine
line: Yes, it's for you... Just take it.

speaker: Barrle
line: Is this for real? Someone is actually giving me a gift? Not for my parents, but for me... Thank you, thank you so much!

speaker: Aventurine
line: Oh, it's not much. I just want to ask you something.

speaker: Barrle
line: ...Ugh, I knew it. What's on your mind? Are you trying to ask about my father, or my mother?

speaker: Aventurine
line: Um... neither. I just wanted to know if you've ever heard about "Death" in the Dreamscape?

speaker: Barrle
line: Oh, you sound just like my father... Always warning me about danger even in dreams.

speaker: Barrle
line: He's an Intellitron , so his dream entry methods are different from us organics. Can't count on him to protect me if something does go haywire. Funny, right now I'm still under his protection... Heh, how ironic...

speaker: Aventurine
line: ...Hey, stay positive. Gold will always shine one day, right?

speaker: Barrle
line: Hmm... Were you wanting to talk to me? Sorry, I thought you were checking out something behind me.

speaker: Aventurine
line: (The Devil of SoulGlad, dangers in the dream, and nightmare ghosts... Surely, "Death" is a popular topic in this sweet dream granted by The Family. I've collected a bunch of rumors, but no useful clues...)

speaker: Aventurine
line: (The gems in my bag are running low... Let's see if my last lucky interviewee brings some surprises.)

text: Distribute the last of the gems

title: Step Description
content: You are about to run out of money, and the ringing in your ears is getting louder. It does not bode well, and you need to hurry up.

line: Remember what I said? You Sigonians are better off hiding in the sewers...
Look at you, snooping around and sticking your nose everywhere...

speaker: Sparkle
line: Is the smell of "Death" so enticing, my fine fellow?

speaker: Aventurine
line: Heh... it's you, Masked Fool . I should have guessed it. You're the "imposter" who appeared on TV after Robin's death, right?

speaker: Sparkle
line: I heard you got caught by The Family? I gave you a clear clue... "Befriend a mute." Simple and straightforward, you know...?

speaker: Sparkle
line: And what did you do? You messed it up and ended up as their prisoner. I told you to make friends with a mute, not become one yourself. You really let me down.

speaker: Aventurine
line: ...What do you mean?

speaker: Sparkle
line: You know better than I do. Who watched the little songbird that couldn't sing perish right before their eyes? You did, Blondie.

speaker: Aventurine
line: No, I mean... what did you mean by "becoming one myself"?

speaker: Sparkle
line: Well, it means you'll soon end up like her, unable to speak ever again.

speaker: Sparkle
line: But it's a good thing, if you ask me, because...

speaker: Aventurine
line: Because I'm getting closer to the truth, right?

speaker: Aventurine
line: Why else do you think I'm handing out cheap trinkets all over the streets, Fool?

speaker: Aventurine
line: All part of the act. Fool's bait. The more pathetic I seem, the more likely you'll come sniffing around. So. Now that I've drawn you out, will you reward me with an answer for my efforts?

speaker: Sparkle
line: Why should I help you?

speaker: Aventurine
line: Don't you want to see Penacony descend into chaos? Well, I can make it happen. I just need an answer to one question: Back then, when you asked me to find a "mute"...

speaker: Aventurine
line: ...Did you really mean Robin?

speaker: Sparkle
line: ...And what if I say "no"?

speaker: Aventurine
line: Then I'll thank you. The word "no" has never sounded so pleasing.

speaker: Sparkle
line: Well done. I admit I underestimated you, but what difference would it make?

speaker: Sparkle
line: Let me tell you something. There were two mutes, but one is dead now, [ Note 1 ] and the other ... Though "she" is still in Penacony, I'm afraid you'll never find "her" again.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Now I'm completely sure that I was on the right track from the beginning and never strayed, Fool.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Right now, there are only two things missing from my grasp: The meaning behind the truth and the means to expose it.

speaker: Sparkle
line: How impressive! That's quite a fancy way of saying "I haven't learned anything so far."

speaker: Aventurine
line: Not exactly. I've gathered enough clues to prove its existence, and that's enough for me. As for the answers to my questions, I'll find them within seventeen... no, sixteen system hours.

speaker: Sparkle
line: Oh, really? "Only" sixteen system hours? Well, let me lend you a hand.

speaker: Sparkle
line: Here you go. This is my precious "Mutually Assured Destruction" button, and I have one just like it. When either of us presses it, the other and the whole of Penacony will go up in smoke.

speaker: Sparkle
line: If you're really so desperate for the IPC to take over Penacony... blowing up the chessboard isn't a bad idea. Start from scratch! That's where the IPC excels, right?

speaker: Sparkle
line: Just press the button when you're at your wit's end. And of course, feel free to reach out to me for my "hospice care" too!

speaker: Aventurine
line: A deadly button, huh?... I guess The Family didn't take your threats seriously at all? Otherwise, how on earth did you manage to bring it in here?

speaker: Sparkle
line: I have my own ways. That's all you need to know.

speaker: Aventurine
line: I'm afraid I'll have to decline your offer. Who knows if your little gadget will actually work? By the way, I have no plans to search for the other mute friend you speak of, but it's good to hear that he's still here in Penacony.

speaker: Aventurine
line: I'll handle the rest myself. I'll orchestrate a grand finale for the downfall of The Family. And at the climax, the walls will crumble, people will wake up, and those who couldn't speak will find their voices again ...

speaker: Aventurine
line: When that time comes, go ahead and press the button, and light up the sky with a magnificent fireworks display for me. Catch you later, Fool.

speaker: Sparkle
line: You're still talking big... But sure, if that happens, I'll stay true to my word.

speaker: Sparkle
line: Just don't let me down now, okay?

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Heaven is a Place on Earth.mp4

speaker: Indifferent Male
line: So, No. 35, you're back. Like your new lucky charm?

speaker: Aventurine
line: ...Can a "commodity code" really be considered a lucky charm?

speaker: Indifferent Male
line: Silence. I didn't give you permission to speak, you Sigonian hound.

speaker: Indifferent Male
line: The guys in black didn't say much, so I've no idea what you did to save your skin in that massacre back in the day.

speaker: Indifferent Male
line: But I figured you must have had good luck, so I bought you. From now on, you and your good luck are MY assets. Are we clear?

speaker: Indifferent Male
line: Your first task is simple. In addition to you, I've purchased thirty... well, thirty-four other slaves.

speaker: Indifferent Male
line: Go and play a "game" with them. If you come out alive after two days, it proves that you're the real deal.

speaker: Aventurine
line: ...You're insane.

speaker: Indifferent Male
line: Heh, testing out if you're a good product.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Aren't you worried that the money you spent on me will go to waste?

speaker: Indifferent Male
line: I've got stacks on stacks, blondie. The slave market is never short of self-righteous brats like you.

speaker: Indifferent Male
line: But you look good, and that's why many customers are betting their fortunes on a scrawny brat like you. So, go along now, and don't let your master down.

speaker: Aventurine
line: ...How much did you spend?

speaker: Indifferent Male
line: What?

speaker: Aventurine
line: My price. How much did you pay for me?

speaker: Indifferent Male
line: Huh, you really want to know? Well, it was sixty Tanba . No more, no less.

speaker: Aventurine
line: ...I'll take my chances.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Thirty Tanba... If I come back alive, you'll give me thirty Tanba. Deal?

speaker: Indifferent Male
line: Hahaha, are you trying to strike a bet with me? Well, you've got some guts!

speaker: Indifferent Male
line: Sorry, but that won't do. Don't forget your place, slave. You're not qualified to be at the table.

speaker: Indifferent Male
line: You're just a chip, a life thrown away in someone else's hands. Either you come back with more chips for your master, or... you never come back.

speaker: Indifferent Male
line: It's all or nothing. Don't embarrass me, my lucky hound .

text: When you have a chance to make a choice, make one that you know you won't regret.
